translations.en: CONSIDER the daybreak
and the ten nights!
Consider the multiple and the One!
Consider the night as it runs its course!

arabicText: هَلۡ فِی ذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ قَسَمࣱ لِّذِی حِجۡرٍ

translations.en: Considering all this - could there be, to anyone endowed with reason, a [more] solemn evidence of the truth?
translations.ar: هَلۡ فِی ذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ قَسَمࣱ لِّذِی حِجۡرٍ

arabicText: أَلَمۡ تَرَ كَیۡفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِعَادٍ

translations.en: ART THOU NOT aware of how thy Sustainer has dealt with [the tribe of] ‘Ad,
translations.ar: أَلَمۡ تَرَ كَیۡفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِعَادٍ

translations.en: [the people of] Iram the many-pillared,

arabicText: ٱلَّتِی لَمۡ یُخۡلَقۡ مِثۡلُهَا فِی ٱلۡبِلَـٰدِ

translations.en: the like of whom has never been reared in all the land? –
translations.ar: ٱلَّتِی لَمۡ یُخۡلَقۡ مِثۡلُهَا فِی ٱلۡبِلَـٰدِ

translations.en: and with [the tribe of] Thamud, who hollowed out rocks in the valley? –
and with Pharaoh of the [many] tent-poles?
[It was they] who transgressed all bounds of equity all over their lands,
and brought about great corruption therein:
and therefore thy Sustainer let loose upon them a scourge of suffering:
for, verily, thy Sustainer is ever on the watch!

arabicText: فَأَمَّا ٱلۡإِنسَـٰنُ إِذَا مَا ٱبۡتَلَىٰهُ رَبُّهُۥ فَأَكۡرَمَهُۥ وَنَعَّمَهُۥ فَیَقُولُ رَبِّیۤ أَكۡرَمَنِ

translations.en: BUT AS FOR man, whenever his Sustainer tries him by His generosity and by letting him enjoy a life of ease, he says, "My Sustainer has been [justly] generous towards me";
translations.ar: فَأَمَّا ٱلۡإِنسَـٰنُ إِذَا مَا ٱبۡتَلَىٰهُ رَبُّهُۥ فَأَكۡرَمَهُۥ وَنَعَّمَهُۥ فَیَقُولُ رَبِّیۤ أَكۡرَمَنِ

arabicText: وَأَمَّاۤ إِذَا مَا ٱبۡتَلَىٰهُ فَقَدَرَ عَلَیۡهِ رِزۡقَهُۥ فَیَقُولُ رَبِّیۤ أَهَـٰنَنِ

translations.en: whereas, whenever He tries him by straitening his means of livelihood, he says, "My Sustainer has disgraced me!"
translations.ar: وَأَمَّاۤ إِذَا مَا ٱبۡتَلَىٰهُ فَقَدَرَ عَلَیۡهِ رِزۡقَهُۥ فَیَقُولُ رَبِّیۤ أَهَـٰنَنِ

translations.en: But nay, nay, [O men, consider all that you do and fail to do:] you are not generous towards the orphan,
and you do not urge one another to feed the needy,
and you devour the inheritance [of others] with devouring greed,
and you love wealth with boundless love!

arabicText: كَلَّاۤۖ إِذَا دُكَّتِ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ دَكࣰّا دَكࣰّا

translations.en: Nay, but [how will you fare on Judgment Day,] when the earth is crushed with crushing upon crushing,
translations.ar: كَلَّاۤۖ إِذَا دُكَّتِ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ دَكࣰّا دَكࣰّا

translations.en: and [the majesty of] thy Sustainer stands revealed, as well as [the true nature of] the angels; rank upon rank?

arabicText: وَجِا۟یۤءَ یَوۡمَىِٕذِۭ بِجَهَنَّمَۚ یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ یَتَذَكَّرُ ٱلۡإِنسَـٰنُ وَأَنَّىٰ لَهُ ٱلذِّكۡرَىٰ

translations.en: And on that Day hell will be brought [within sight]; on that Day man will remember [all that he did and failed to do]: but what will that remembrance avail him?
translations.ar: وَجِا۟یۤءَ یَوۡمَىِٕذِۭ بِجَهَنَّمَۚ یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ یَتَذَكَّرُ ٱلۡإِنسَـٰنُ وَأَنَّىٰ لَهُ ٱلذِّكۡرَىٰ

translations.en: He will say, "Oh, would that I had. provided beforehand for my life [to come]!"
For, none can make suffer as He will make suffer [the sinners] on that Day,
and none can bind with bonds like His.
[But unto the righteous God will say,] "O thou human being that hast attained to inner peace!
Return thou unto thy Sustainer, well-pleased [and] pleasing [Him]:
enter, then, together with My [other true] servants –
yea, enter thou My paradise!"
